Row.Text: The Church of Madoka is a religion which teaches the existence of an omniscient and omnipresent Magical Girl named Madoka Kaname. There are no records indicating that such a person was ever born in this world. Though its primary constituents are Magical Girls, many young women without the potential for magic -- and even many men -- are also known to be active members.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The name of Madoka was first spoken by the prophet Homura Akemi. According to Akemi's gospel, before the advent of Madoka, Magical Girls lived in an alternate universe in which they became murderous monsters known as Witches once their Soul Gem became fully tainted. It was only through the power of Madoka's selfless wish that they can now live a happier existence. No further evidence has been uncovered to affirm the existence of such a girl. Yet, thousands of Magical Girls have accepted Akemi's gospel and feel an unspeakable gratitude towards Madoka.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Madoka Kaname is often compared to Jesus Christ due to certain parallels between their stories. According to the Gospel of Akemi, Madoka's wish caused her to absorb all of the curses from every Magical Girl in the past, present, and future, much like the death of Jesus forgave all humans of sin. It has also been noted that the date of Madoka's wish and her deification seems to have been on Good Friday -- coinciding with the date of Jesus's crucifixion.
